paper_dropbox_requests.title: IEEE VIS 2022 Upload Request for {UID}
paper_dropbox_requests.description: Please upload all the material for {UID} that has been requested.

email_template_test.subject: Some Test Mail for Paper {UID}
email_template_test.body_text: We regret to inform you that your request for paper {Title} has not been granted
email_template_test.body_html:
Hello

We regret to inform you that your request for paper {Title} has not been granted

upload_request_full_short.subject: IEEE VIS 2023 Upload Request
upload_request_full_short.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)}
Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2023 of your paper with the unique submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.
As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8. 
We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2023 lasts until Friday, September 8. One author/presenter for each work is required to register at the rates outlined on http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/registration/conference-registration. 
This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Five points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.
For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via our Presentation Material Upload system:

{PMU Upload Link}

Please refer to the Talk Recording Guide that lists the technical requirements for your presentation materials and contains more detailed information on how to prepare and submit the requested materials: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. 

1. Video Preview Submission. Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Presentation Material Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews. 
The deadline for the video preview is August 22.

2. Paper Presentation Video Recording. All VIS papers should be accompanied by a recording of the paper presentation. Authors will give their talks in person at the conference, in addition to submitting a recording of the paper presentation. Detailed instructions regarding these recordings are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via our Presentation Material Upload system. 
The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 8.

3. Representative Image. As described in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption file, for use on the virtual website. The same paper specific Presentation Material Upload link as above should be used for uploading the representative image. Deadline is September 8.

For these 6 files, please follow the technical specifications outlined in the detailed instructions page: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.
After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.


4. Author Information Form. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed. Specifically, we need information regarding (a) who will be presenting the paper, (b) if you plan in person or virtual attendance, (c) if you have posted your paper to a preprint server (and where), (d) if this publication is subject to Plan S, and (e) practitioner information.
Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/ueHiYLCtgExw4in76
Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form. Deadline for completing the form is September 8.

5. Copyright Release. Finally, for papers that will be published in IEEE TVCG or on IEEE Xplore. Please expect an email after you complete your final manuscript submission with additional instructions on how to complete this information. 
Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2023 Publications Chairs
Arvind Satyanarayan, Katerina Vrotsou, and Zhicheng Liu
upload_request_full_short.body_html:
IEEE VIS 2023 Upload Request

http://ieeevis.org/

Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2023 of your paper with the unique submission {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.

As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8.

We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2023 lasts until Friday, September 8. One author/presenter for each work is required to register at the rates outlined on: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/registration/conference-registration .

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Five points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors

For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via our Presentation Material Upload system:

{PMU Upload Link}

Please refer to the Talk Recording Guide that lists the technical requirements for your presentation materials and contains more detailed information on how to prepare and submit the requested materials: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide .

  1. Video Preview Submission

    Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Presentation Material Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}.

    Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews .

    The deadline for the video preview is August 22.

  2. Paper Presentation Video Recording

    All VIS papers should be accompanied by a recording of the paper presentation. Authors will give their talks in person at the conference, in addition to submitting a recording of the paper presentation.

    Detailed instructions regarding these recordings are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide .

    The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via the Presentation Material Upload system.

    The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 8.

  3. Representative Image

    As described in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use on the virtual website. The same Presentation Material Upload link as above should be used for uploading the representative image.

    The deadline is September 8.

For these 6 files, please follow the technical specifications outlined in the detailed instructions page: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide .

After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

  1. Author Information Form

    Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed. Specifically, we need information regarding (a) who will be presenting the paper, (b) if you plan in person or virtual attendance, (c) if you have posted your paper to a preprint server (and where), (d) if this publication is subject to Plan S, and (e) practitioner information.

    Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/ueHiYLCtgExw4in76

    Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form. The deadline for completing the form is September 8.

  2. Copyright Release

    Finally, for papers that will be published in IEEE TVCG or on IEEE Xplore. Please expect an email after you complete your final manuscript submission with additional instructions on how to complete this information.

Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org .

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2023 Publications Chairs

Arvind Satyanarayan, Katerina Vrotsou, and Zhicheng Liu

upload_request_tvcg_cga.subject: IEEE VIS 2023 Upload Request
upload_request_tvcg_cga.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance of your invited VIS 2023 presentation. This email provides instructions for uploading materials to the conference. For administrative purposes, we have assigned you a unique submission ID, {UID}, for your paper “{Title}”.
We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2023 lasts until Friday, September 8. One author/presenter for each work is required to register at the rates outlined on: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/registration/conference-registration. 
This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Four points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.
For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via our Presentation Material Upload system:          

{PMU Upload Link}

Please refer to the Talk Recording Guide that lists the technical requirements for your presentation materials and contains more detailed information on how to prepare and submit the requested materials: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.

1. Video Preview Submission. Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Presentation Material Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your presentation with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews. 
The deadline for the video preview is September 8.

2. Paper Presentation Video Recording. All VIS presentations should be accompanied by a recording of the presentation. Authors will give their talks in person at the conference, in addition to submitting a recording of the paper presentation. Detailed instructions regarding these recordings are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via the Presentation Material Upload system. The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 8.

3. Representative Image. As described in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use on the virtual website. The same Presentation Material Upload link as above should be used for uploading the representative image. Deadline is September 8.
For these 6 files, please follow the technical specifications outlined in the detailed instructions page: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.
After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

4. Author Information Form. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed. Specifically, we need information regarding (a) who will be presenting the paper, (b) if you plan in person or virtual attendance, and (c) practitioner information.
Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/ueHiYLCtgExw4in76
Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form.  Deadline for completing the form is September 8.
 
Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2023 Publications Chairs
Arvind Satyanarayan, Katerina Vrotsou, and Zhicheng Liu
